title: Matrix Saddle Points
problem_statement:
Matrix Saddle Points

You are given integers your task is to search for the "saddle points" in an N×N array of integers. A saddle point is a cell whose value is greater than or equal to any other cell in its row, and less than or equal to any other cell in its column. There may be more than one saddle point in the array.

Input Format

  • The first and second lines are integers N, denoting the size of the square matrix.
  • The next N lines, we have the N x N square matrix with space-separated integers.

Output Format

  • If there are saddle points, return their coordinates in ascending order, formatted as (row,column) (1-based indexing).
  • If there are no saddle points, return -1.

Constraints

  • 1 ≤ N ≤ 10 (Size of the matrix)
  • 1 ≤ element of matrix ≤ 100 (Value of elements in the matrix)

Sample Test Cases

Sample Input 1:

5
5
8 9 11 12 3
10 11 12 13 4
22 23 24 25 5
26 27 28 29 10

Sample Output 1:

1 5

Explanation:

For the first row [8,9,11,12,3], the maximum element is 12 at position (1,4).

Now, check column 5: [3,4,5,10]. The element 3 is the smallest in its column, satisfying the condition for a saddle point.

Thus, the saddle point is at position (1,5).

Sample Input 2:

5
5
19 18 16 15 12
11 10 10 10 9
9 9 9 8 8
7 6 7 6 6
6 6 6 6 7

Sample Output 2:

-1

In this matrix, none of the rows' maximum values satisfy the condition of being the smallest in their respective columns. Therefore, there are no saddle points, and the output is -1.

Execution Time Limit

10 seconds

title: Maximum Sum Sub-array
problem_statement:
Maximum Sum Sub-array

Write a program that will take a 2-dimensional array as input. For a given 2-dimensional array of size n × n (n < 100), find the sub-array of size m × m (m < n and m >= 2) that has the largest sum. The array contains integers i.e. negative, positive, and zero.

Input Format

  • The first line contains n denoting the number of rows.
  • The second line contains n denoting the number of columns.
  • Next n lines contain n elements each of which is the elements of the array.

Output Format

A 2-D array with the maximum sum.

Constraints

  • 2 ≤ n < 100
  • 2 ≤ m < n
  • -103 < arrayij < 103

Examples

Sample Input 1

5
5
1 2 3 4 5
2 4 7 -2 1
4 3 9 9 1
5 2 6 8 0
2 1 8 9 0

Sample Output 1

2 4 7 2
4 3 9 9
5 2 6 8
2 1 8 9

Explanation

This sub-array has a size of 4×4 and has a sum of 77 which is the largest among all possible sub-arrays of size 2×2 or larger.

Sample Input 2

5
5
1 0 0 0 -2
0 1 0 0 0
-3 2 0 -2 0
0 0 0 -3 -2
0 0 0 0 -1

Sample Output 2

1 0
2 0

Explanation

This sub-array has a size of 2×2 and has a sum of 3, which is the largest among all possible sub-arrays of size 2×2 or larger.
